title: Build Issues On Mac OSX Sierra

content.raw:
Installing gazebo8 on Sierra produced the following error:

cd /tmp/sdformat5-20170318-4245-1wwiz7a/sdformat-5.1.0/build/src && /usr/local/Cellar/cmake/3.7.2/bin/cmake -E cmake_symlink_library libsdformat.5.1.0.dylib libsdformat.5.dylib libsdformat.dylib
[ 16%] Built target sdformat
make: *** [all] Error 2

Upon examining the error, the line 276 of file:

https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/e5104282e829bc88e484bd2f63af86f3bde6bd42/tools/xmlschema.rb?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default

was complaining that the method .exists? did not exist.  This is true as of version 1.8 of ruby, which is what is installed by default for Sierra.  I have RVM installed with ruby 2.2 as the default version.  However, the build procedure for sdformat hardwires the call to ruby to /usr/local/bin/ruby, which is the 1.8 version on Mac.  So I temporarily copied that version off somewhere else and then created the symlink as follows:

sudo ln -sfn $(which ruby) /usr/local/bin/ruby

Build then continued past this error.

cd /tmp/sdformat5-20170318-4245-1wwiz7a/sdformat-5.1.0/build/src && /usr/local/Cellar/cmake/3.7.2/bin/cmake -E cmake_symlink_library libsdformat.5.1.0.dylib libsdformat.5.dylib libsdformat.dylib [ 16%] Built target sdformat make: *** [all] Error 2

Upon examining the error, the line 276 of file:

https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/e5104282e829bc88e484bd2f63af86f3bde6bd42/tools/xmlschema.rb?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default

was complaining that the method .exists? did not exist. This is true as of version 1.8 of ruby, which is what is installed by default for Sierra. I have RVM installed with ruby 2.2 as the default version. However, the build procedure for sdformat hardwires the call to ruby to /usr/local/bin/ruby, which is the 1.8 version on Mac. So I temporarily copied that version off somewhere else and then created the symlink as follows:

sudo ln -sfn $(which ruby) /usr/local/bin/ruby

Build then continued past this error.
